Question: What is the main purpose of system modeling in software engineering?
C: To create abstract representations that help understand and communicate the system

Question: What does a context model primarily show?
A: The internal algorithms of the system
B: The system boundaries and the external systems it interacts with
C: The sequence of method calls inside classes
D: The database schema of the system

Question: Which UML diagram is best suited to show the order of interactions between actors and system components during a use case?
C: State diagram

Question: What is the main benefit of using generalization (inheritance) in class diagrams?
B: It removes the need for interfaces
C: It reduces complexity by allowing common attributes and operations to be shared
D: It guarantees that the system will be reusable

Question: Which statement correctly describes architectural drift and architectural erosion?
C: Both drift and erosion are planned architectural changes
D: Drift introduces changes not planned but not violating the architecture

Question: What is the main goal of software reviews?
C: To detect errors and improve software quality

Question: Which of the following best describes a formal review?
B: A scheduled review conducted by senior participants to approve a product
C: A test executed after implementation

Question: What is the key difference between a walkthrough and an inspection?
C: Walkthroughs focus on management issues

Question: Why are reviews considered more cost-effective when performed early in the software life cycle?
A: Early reviews eliminate the need for maintenance
B: Reviews replace unit and integration testing
C: The cost of defect removal increases significantly in later phases
D: Reviews prevent all defects from occurring

Question: What is not considered a purpose of software reviews?
C: Approving a product to move to the next phase
D: Evaluating the project budget and schedule

Question: What is one key limitation of software testing?
A: It guarantees the software has no defects
B: It can only show the presence of defects not their absence
C: It replaces the need for requirements

Question: Which activity focuses on checking whether the system meets user needs?
C: Debugging

Question: What is the main goal of software architecture?
C: Defining the systemâ€™s main structural design decisions

Question: Which of the following is an advantage of software inspections over dynamic testing?
C: They can be applied before implementation

Question: What is the primary purpose of equivalence partitioning in black-box testing?
A: To test every possible input value
B: To reduce the number of test cases while maintaining coverage
C: To analyze internal code structure

Question: What is written first in Test-Driven Development (TDD)?
C: The test cases

Question: What does cyclomatic complexity primarily indicate?
C: Number of independent execution paths

Question: Which situation best fits the use of a Layered Architecture?
B: When components frequently bypass each other
C: When multiple teams develop different abstraction levels
D: When the system has only one user interface

Question: Why is regression testing critical during software maintenance?
C: To ensure changes did not break existing functionality

Question: Why is requirements-based testing considered effective?
B: It tests only user interface components
C: It directly links tests to documented requirements
D: It eliminates the need for system testing
